definition: to grant whatever is asked for/to accede to every plea
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
certainly/must/will/necessarily
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
surname Ying
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: It is impossible to satisfy all demands.
You can have for the asking all the peace you want.
sentences.chinese: 你若真心想要平静，自当有求必应。

sentences.english: He gave good practical advice when (he was) asked.
sentences.chinese: 他有求必应，给出了好的可行性建议。

sentences.english: Once a prospect is generated, sales follow-ups are personalized and very soft touch.
sentences.chinese: 一旦产生预期，销售跟进很个性化，而且有求必应。

sentences.english: This hotel advertises that it spoils its guests.
sentences.chinese: 该旅馆做广告说他们对顾客是有求必应。

sentences.english: She always gave the right answers.
Two, courtesy trest person, service enthusiasm, receive Li quick, have to beg surely should.
sentences.chinese: 礼貌待人，服务热情，接礼迅速，有求必应。

sentences.english: When you're in a bad mood, your friend agrees with whatever you say.
sentences.chinese: 当你心情不好时，朋友对你有求必应。

sentences.english: That kind of responsiveness will get you a level of goodwill money won´t buy.
sentences.chinese: 有求必应将为你实现商誉投资也无法实现的价值。
约瑟夫对妻子有求必应。

sentences.english: God was very good and gave His creatures what they asked.
sentences.chinese: 上帝真是太好了，他对他所创造的众生有求必应。

sentences.english: Her father had never refused her anything.
sentences.chinese: 她父亲对她素来是有求必应的。

sentences.english: His mother is a soft touch.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲是一个有求必应的人。

definition: docile and obedient/all obedience
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
to the utmost/in every possible way
totally submissive (idiom)
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
in every possible way (idiom); meticulous
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
earnestly and sincerely (idiom)/with all sincerity
to be available at any time/to be on call
to follow obediently
kind and charitable
to refuse nobody (idiom)/all comers welcome
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to welcome sb with a smiling face (idiom)
earnestly and sincerely (idiom); with all sincerity
